Class Printer

java.lang.Object
  Printer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Printable
public class Printer
extends Object
implements Printable

Helper class designed to make printing easier. Basic principle is that this class will act like an output stream allowing for text and graphics be outputted on it. Text are displayed on a line by line format (location of the beginning of the text is preset and follows a uniform pattern. Images can be displayed anywhere and options are available to resize a given image based on the dimensions of the paper.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Daniel Chen

Constructor Detail

Printer

public Printer()
Creates a Printer object with Serif size 12 font.

Printer

public Printer(Font f)

Parameters:

Method Detail

println

public void println()
Queues an empty line to be printed. Adds empty Strings to the ArrayLists which will occur in an empty line being printed.

println

public void println(String text)
Queues a String alligned on the left side to be printed. Adds the String to the left ArrayList and empty Strings to the others.

Parameters:
text - The text to be displayed on the left.

println

public void println(String leftText,
                    String centerText,
                    String rightText)
Queues a line with different text alligned on different places to be printed. Each String will be drawn starting at different locations. The one on the left will be at the margins, the one in the center will be displayed with its center alligned with the center of the page and the right most one will end on the right margin.

Parameters:
leftText - The text that will be displayed on the left side.
centerText - The text that will be centered.
rightText - The text that will be displayed on the right side.

printImage

public void printImage(BufferedImage image,
                       Point location)
Queues an image to be printed.
The image will be drawn at the location specified without any proccessing for if it goes off the page. Images will automatically be moved a bit to the right and down based on the margin of the imageable areas of the paper - (0, 0) will print at the closest location which isn't necessarily the exact top left of the page.

Parameters:
image - The image to be printed.
location - The location of the image. Syntax is: new Point (x, y).

printImage

public void printImage(BufferedImage image,
                       Point location,
                       int percent,
                       boolean useWidth)
Queues a square image to be printed with the length based on a percent of one of the dimensions of the paper. The length of the image will be calculated based on the percent multiplied by the width or height of the paper (specified by the boolean).
The image will be drawn at the location specified without any proccessing for if it goes off the page. Images will automatically be moved a bit to the right and down based on the margin of the imageable areas of the paper - (0, 0) will print at the closest location which isn't necessarily the exact top left of the page.

Parameters:
image - The image to be printed.
location - The location of the image. Syntax is: new Point (x, y).
percent - The percentage of the dimension to be taken up (0 - 100).
useWidth - Boolean for wether to base the percent on width or height.

printImage

public void printImage(BufferedImage image,
                       Point location,
                       int percentWidth,
                       int percentHeight)
Queues an image to be printed with the length based on the percent of the dimensions of the paper. The width of the image will be calculated based on the width of the paper multiplied by the percentWidth and the height by the percentHeight.
The image will be drawn at the location specified without any proccessing for if it goes off the page. Images will automatically be moved a bit to the right and down based on the margin of the imageable areas of the paper - (0, 0) will print at the closest location which isn't necessarily the exact top left of the page.

Parameters:
image - The image to be printed.
location - The location of the image. Syntax is: new Point (x, y).
percentWidth - The percentage of the width of the paper to base the width of the image on.
percentHeight - The percentage of the height of the paper to base the height of the image on.

printUsingDialog

public boolean printUsingDialog()
Signals the printer to start printing. Users will be able to modify print conditions using the dialog box that popups up.

Returns:
boolean representing whether or not the print was sucessful.

print

public int print(Graphics g,
                 PageFormat pf,
                 int page)
          throws PrinterException
Method invoked by PrinterJob to render a page. The queued text and images to be displayed are rendered on to the paper and the printed. Do NOT try to call directly, use printUsingDialog () instead.

Specified by:
print in interface Printable
Parameters:
g - The context into which the page is drawn.
pf - The size and orientation of the page being drawn.
page - The zero based index of the page to be drawn.
Returns:
PAGE_EXISTS if the page is rendered successfully or NO_SUCH_PAGE if pageIndex specifies a non-existent page.
Throws:
PrinterException - thrown when the print job is terminated.
